channel.title: Mac on cat ~/differing-opinions.txt > /dev/null
channel.description: Recent content in Mac on cat ~/differing-opinions.txt > /dev/null

item.title: Keybase Filesystem
item.description: Keybase has a great feature called kbfs. You get 10 Gigs of storage forever. They say that it will be free going forward, and I would like to believe them because I don’t think Keybase will ever really be popular. I would love to eat those words. They mention that you should not expect your files to be resilient; this is an Alpha service, so there is no guarantee of safety.

item.title: Take Screenshot Directly to Preview
item.description: Okay this is my first foray in to AppleScript, and I have to say that I don’t hate it. I wanted a way to take screenshots directly in to Preview on my Mac. Turns out that the screenshot utility is available on the command line: > screencapture -h screencapture: illegal option -- h usage: screencapture [-icMPmwsWxSCUtoa] [files] -c force screen capture to go to the clipboard -b capture Touch Bar - non-interactive modes only .
